title: Polozzi
text:
José Fernando Polozzi (born October 1, 1955 in <a href="Vinhedo">Vinhedo</a>, <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20State">São Paulo State</a>), best known as Polozzi, is a former <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football (soccer)</a> player in central defender role, currently managed <a href="Bandeirante%20Esporte%20Clube">Bandeirante</a>'s team.
Career.
Born in <a href="Vinhedo">Vinhedo</a>, Polozzi began his football career at <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tica%20Ponte%20Preta">Associação Atlética Ponte Preta</a> under manager <a href="M%C3%A1rio%20Juliato">Mário Juliato</a>. After Polozzi managed to become a regular in Ponte Preta's first team, he helped the club to a strong performance in the 1977 <a href="Campeonato%20Paulista">Campeonato Paulista</a> which led to a role on Brazil's national team.
In career (1972–1992) he played for several number of clubs, including <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tica%20Ponte%20Preta">Ponte Preta</a>, <a href="Sociedade%20Esportiva%20Palmeiras">Palmeiras</a>, <a href="Bangu%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Clube">Bangu</a>, <a href="Oper%C3%A1rio%20Futebol%20Clube%20%28MT%29">Operário (MT)</a> and <a href="Bandeirante%20Esporte%20Clube">Bandeirante</a>. He won <a href="Campeonato%20Sul-Matogrossense">Mato Grosso do Sul State League</a> in 1986.
For the <a href="Brazil%20national%20football%20team">Brazil national football team</a> he was included in the squad for the <a href="1978%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1978 FIFA World Cup</a>, but he never played in an international match.
